column4: Intel says may invest up to $5.5 billion in China memory chip plant
column5: Intel Corp said it may invest up to $5.5 billion in manufacturing semiconductors in China  stepping up efforts to improve ties with Beijing as it seeks new revenue streams while demand for its core computer processing chips falters.

column4: UPDATE 1-Intel says may invest up to $5.5 bln in China memory chip plant
column5: * SK Hynix shares end 5.7 pct lower on earnings worries   (Adds industry background  analyst comment)

column4: Intel may invest up to $5.5 bln in China facility
column5: Oct 21 Intel Corp said it may invest up to $5.5 billion in the coming years to expand its manufacturing capacity for non-volatile memory at its Dalian facility in China.
